meanings.definition: An ancient unit of linear measure, typically equivalent to the length of a forearm.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a cubit to measure the length of the table.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, people often used a cubit to measure distances.
meanings.sent3: The cubit and the foot had a race to see who could measure faster.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling it with a cubit of joy.
meanings.sent5: The cubit of his determination was evident in the way he tackled challenges.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to the length of a forearm, typically about 18 inches.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used a cubit to ensure the perfect fit of the dress.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Egyptians used a cubit as a standard unit of measurement.
meanings.sent3: The cubit and the meter had a friendly competition on who could measure better.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a cubit wide, brightening up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The cubit of his generosity knew no bounds, reaching out to help those in need.
